definition: right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: The embarrassment for the government-and the delight of everybody else-remained.
sentences.chinese: 所以政府的尷尬和人們的喜悅互相對峙。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for Wis-Mpower to continue with its current strdinedgy of large- super centres.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾瑪的機緣存在於對現有大型超市戰略的對峙。

sentences.english: As far as I know, there is no such "face-off" between China and India in the border area.
sentences.chinese: 據我瞭解，中印邊境地區目前不存在“對峙”情況。

sentences.english: This fear is that these minor clashes may develop into all-out confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 人們還怕這些小衝突會發展成爲全面的對峙。

sentences.english: A family setting is whenpeople often let their guard down, which can lead to ugly confrontations.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭環境中，人們往往放鬆警戒而導致醜陋的對峙。

sentences.english: An Atlantic wolf fish (Anarchias lupus) and a shrimp ( Lebbeus polaris) in the waters off Norway.
sentences.chinese: 挪威水域的一條大西洋狼魚和一隻小蝦的對峙。

sentences.english: The surveillance vessel, the USNS Impeccable, was involved in a standoff Sunday with Chinese ships.
sentences.chinese: 無瑕號海軍監測船星期天曾經捲入同中國船支的對峙。

sentences.english: You insist that Dalian is the loading port, right?
sentences.chinese: 您對峙把年夜連定爲裝運港，對嗎？

sentences.english: Stand tall red political power in the land, confrontation with the kuomintang regime.
sentences.chinese: 紅色政權巍然屹立在中華大地上，同國民黨政權對峙。

sentences.english: This one above shows two Lego commandos confront Bin Laden.
sentences.chinese: 而上圖則展示了兩個士兵持槍與拉登對峙。

sentences.english: After a tense standoff, the marchers agreed to board government buses to Deyang, the county seat.
sentences.chinese: 經過一番緊張的對峙，示威者同意坐上去德陽的大巴。

sentences.english: Yet, man choreographers will insist that you dance with your injury.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如斯，很多跳舞編導會對峙要你帶傷跳舞。

sentences.english: They confronted Mr. Pang and he denied stealing.
sentences.chinese: 他們與彭日成對峙，但彭日成否認偷竊。

sentences.english: I need Apple to be harrying Microsoft.
sentences.chinese: 我還想讓蘋果與微軟對峙。

sentences.english: They insisted that she (should) be invited.
But the talks are occurring in an atmosphere of mutual suspicion, in which confrontational invective is growing.
sentences.chinese: 但談判在相互猜疑的氣氛中開始，對峙的惡言在增加。

definition: to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to be in a tangle/to nag
conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
